intro: Croixia luzoniensis, commonly known as the Luzon bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to violet flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as mountain forests and stream banks. It has lance-shaped leaves and produces small, clustered flowers that bloom in the summer months. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
